title: How to Log Out of Other Devices on Instagram on PC or Mac

steps.title: Go to https://www.instagram.com/ in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://www.instagram.com/ in a web browser. You can use any browser. If you aren't already logged into your account , enter your phone number, username, or email and password to do so now.

steps.title: Click ☰ More.
steps.content: Click ☰ More . This is in the left sidebar.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . This is at the top of the pop-up menu.

steps.title: Click Accounts Center.
steps.content: Click Accounts Center . This is the large tile underneath the Settings header.

steps.title: Click Password and security.
steps.content: Click Password and security . You can find this underneath the Account settings header.

steps.title: Click Where you're logged in.
steps.content: Click Where you're logged in . This is the first option underneath the Security checks header.

steps.title: Click your Instagram account.
steps.content: Click your Instagram account. If you have multiple accounts logged into your browser, you'll see them here.

steps.title: Select the device session.
steps.content: Select the device session. You'll see a list of all recent logins along with the time and general area.

steps.title: Click Log out.
steps.content: Click Log out . The devices will be logged out of your account. If you're worried about your account security, you can change your password or enable two-factor authentication. [1] X Research source
